channel.title: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux
channel.description: So i have the software installed(running on linux mint) and the axoloti plugged in, but i cannot connect the patcher to the axoloti as i get a message saying "USB device found insufficient permissions" Im assuming i need to open it with SUDO but i cannot find where the patchers actual launcher software is located to do this :< I have a windows computer i will be able to use later for this(windows vista unfortunetely though) But i'd like to be able to use the patcher on my main comp(the linux mint 10 one im using now)

item.title: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Probably udev is not configured to allow user access to the axoloti usb device.
running add_udev_rules.sh in platform_linux should fix this.

Read full topic
item.source: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux

item.title: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux
item.dc:creator: @alex alex
item.description:
@alex wrote:

no need to use sudo/root .
you can start it from the commandline using
/opt/Axoloti/Axoloti

could be some hotplug issue; try connecting the device before booting.
if that works it could be this:
http://alien.slackbook.org/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=slackware:fixes

Read full topic
item.source: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux

item.title: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux
item.dc:creator: @debterminer Jason Dickson
item.description:
@debterminer wrote:

I have figured it out! Sort of! I went to usr/share/applications then opened axoloti as administrator

Read full topic
item.source: How to solve "USB device found insufficient permissions" linux
